title: Patch Chat with the Playtest Team - Midseason Patch 7.9
body:
https://news-a.akamaihd.net/public/na_images/PCHCHT/Minions.jpg
Header by inkiness

Hey, everyone! I'm Riot King Cobra and it's time for another round of Patch Chat! These threads serve as opportunity for us to talk about the patches that come out every two weeks. You can find the most recent patch by following this link: [Patch 7.9 Notes](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-79-notes).

I'm on Riot's Playtest Team, a group of high elo players who play with the new champions, reworks, balance tweaks, items, and map updates before they are released. It's our job to the test the changes that our designers come up with and ensure that we're introducing positive changes to League in terms of both balance and fun. Ask us questions - we'll try to answer as many as we can!

Patch 7.9 is our big midseason patch.  There's a ton of stuff to talk about this time around. We've updated our tank roster with changes to Maokai, Sejuani, and Zac. We've also made some changes to durability items and added a few more! Support items now have quests and there's more detailed stat-tracking post game. Rift Herald got a makeover and some new mechanics as well.

All of us on the Playtest Team are avid gamers so feel free to talk to us as fellow LoL players! 

Ben “Cezium” Burkhardt
Don “Aesah” Ding
Nicolas “Gleeb” Haddad
Dan “penguin” Hardison
Robert “ROBERTxLEE” Lee
Rob "King Cobra" Rosa
Nicholas “Nickwu” Smith
Blake “S0be” Soberanis
Trevor “ThEntropist” Thernes
Arnor "Hjarta" Halldorsson
Brian "Madness Heroo" Pressoir

replies.body:
{{champion:113}} 
She's hella fun and actually feels like a Barbarian warleader, she's probably my favorite of the three tank reworks.
Though people seem to think she's a tad overpowered.

{{champion:57}} 
Ah, I'm nostalgic about that one as I played a ton of Maokai Jungle back when I started playing.
He's more of a vanguard now and I'll miss Vengeful Maelstrom but I think it's a step in the right direction as it makes him less of a generalist.

{{champion:154}} 
The change to his voice made me drop him, it gets old really fast and I wished it only kicked in when he's low HP


Overall I think these updates are more moderate than the prior ones and they don't seem hilariously overpowered like some other reworks.

and this
<{{item:1054}} >
This is one of the best changes as it makes it a legitimate starting item for heavy poke lanes, especially for my Mid lane Mordekaiser.

And since we're already talking about items:

Thoughts on {{item:3146}} being built on mages like Leblanc, Ahri and some times even Orianna?

We're looking at {{item:3146}} . Personally, I really don't like that Leblanc and Ahri are building it. However, I know others here think it's a cool choice for them to be able to make in a build (which I also agree with to an extent).

whats so bad about Leblanc and Ahri building it? Is it because they're ranged and not Melee and thus use it as additional poke instead of All-in??

can you please extrapolate on why you feel that way and what the target champions/roles ARE for this item? I think the main problem with the item is clarity. Its not really obvious who its really for. Everyone can take advantage of the omnivamp and it has both AP AND AD making it "workable" on just about any champion.

I guess its supposed to be a sustain item for AP champions  and a relegation item post- will of the Ancients removal but that doesn't really explain the AD nor the psuedo-lifesteal.

Sure! And just to put it out there again, this is just my own personal opinion on it. I think it's an item that should be bought by champions like Jax, Kayle, Evelynn, Morde, Katarina, and to an extent Akali. They largely deal hybrid damage and in an ideal world, want the vamp so they can stay in fights longer and use the active to stick to people better.

I don't like the item on LeBlanc and Ahri because I personally think the active slow removes gameplay from their kits by allowing them to confirm their skill shots (Ethereal Chains and Charm mostly) that set up their full combos easier.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot King Cobra,realm=NA,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=pEaw7YEv,comment-id=0001000100040000,timestamp=2017-05-04T04:01:48.994+0000)
>
> to an extent Akali. They largely deal hybrid damage and in an ideal world, want the vamp so they can stay in fights longer and use the active to stick to people better.

"To an extent"? Akali, out of all of the champions you listed, has been going Gunblade as a solid core first item since season 1 due to her insane synergy with everything Gunblade is about. She makes far better use of how Gunblade is suppose to work compared to any other 'intended' champion. Sorry if this maybe due to wording, but how it is written as 'to an extent', it makes it seem like you think Akali is not suppose to go for this item when history has shown otherwise...

Apart from that, it isn't just the slow on Gunblade's active that's making it a problem. There's the high damage on it as well. If it was purely the slow, GLP gives more relevant stats (same 80 AP, but HP/MP with a decent passive) with a slow as well (both have dashes to easily hit enemies with active). But Ahri and LB are not building GLP over Gunblade. The only difference here is the damage of the actives making them lend towards to always picking Gunblade up over GLP.

Woops, my bad. I meant to remove that part and just have Akali listed. The sentence was originally about sustained damage champs and then I was like well actually Akali is more burst.....then decided to removed the sustained damage bit without removing that. You're right though!

> has been going Gunblade as a solid core first item since season 1

Well, that's not a good argument. Item change and evolve over time, as do champs. What's important is the current state of affairs. Not saying I disagree with the rest of the post, just with this part.

I realize you corrected yourself already on the champs that are likely to use this item, but I dont really see how Akali and Ahri being serial users of Gunblade are necessarily a bad thing. I mean, the item could be overtuned, but the concept of them having some level of omnivamp is really not all that bad, especially in the case of Leblanc. I think leblanc right now is punished very hard when she gets pushed out of teamfights, and is on her own a relatively poor splitpusher because she has no sustain. This new build gives her some depth. Ahri is in a similar state, though less so. Also note that the new banshees implementation is definitely going to warp the use cases of this item. Gunblade is going to become an banshees clearer in short order on these assassins, which devalues its use as just an active when compared to the cheaper options of GLP-900 and Protobelt.

All in all, I hope you guys aren't to hasty eliminating this relatively novel build entirely like you are postulating. It definitely adds some variety into these champions builds; a variety that frankly this game has been lacking for too long. I think that it is healthy that people debate whether to go gunblade,  protobelt, morellos, or even abyssal (now banshees) first item, and then tailor their builds accordingly to their playstyle. Dont take that away please. 

If gunblade active is overpowered in terms of damage or utility, nerf it, sure. But dont gut the item please. As you pointed out, its very unclear who this item is even for, so I fail to understand how adding new users, especially short range assassins which are already risky to play and strictly gated by cooldowns, is verboten.

I don't think Akali being a user is a bad thing. But to address your concern, we aren't going to jump to conclusions - and you're right that it does add variety into these champion builds - after all not everybody does build it.  I would not worry about us gutting the item. There are designers and playtesters here that agree with you in that it is a really cool purchase on those champs! :)

I'm all for variety!

Hell, as long as it provides HP, AD, AP or resistances I can build it on Morde and it's always fun to try out new builds.
But it seems like these mages don't really give up a lot for building it.

Did you already have some ideas what to change about it, be it stats, active or something else entirely?

I personally think a 40 second CD active that deals a lot of damage, scales off AP and also slows might be a tad too much, but that's just me^^

> [{quoted}](name=Malicious Metal,realm=EUW,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=pEaw7YEv,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-05-03T23:04:53.978+0000)
> {{champion:154}} 
> The change to his voice made me drop him, it gets old really fast and I wished it only kicked in when he's low HP

This

Also, can you maybe change the speed up to be a bit slower when the voice gets higher?

We're going to be looking into adjustments for the voice change. Meddler touched on it here in his [Quick Gameplay Thoughts](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/J6vZg0wr-quick-gameplay-thoughts-may-4).
What are your guys thoughts on Ancient Coin and it's new way of collecting gold?

I think the new coin is vastly better designed than the last one as the last iteration promoted stale, passive gameplay. This promotes action, has moments of tension, and also makes RiotHjarta run into minion waves and die to chase coins. :^)

Seconded.

Got baited by gold coins. As a support you often feel a bit gold starved and therefore I think I'm turning into Gollum where my longing for that ~~DELICIOUS SWEET YELLOW OBJECT OF SUSTENANCE~~ gold is so strong that it often leads me to unfortunate situations ...


 ***My precious***

Sorry, but I don't get what's so good in forcing utility supports to face check coins when they are being zoned by aggressive supports who are just waiting for a mistake to kill you ? Was it even considered that Janna, Soraka can't play aggressively vs Brand, Thresh, etc ?

> Was it even considered that Janna, Soraka can't play aggressively vs Brand, Thresh, etc ?

Of course. Risk/reward is a real thing, and those champions didn't previously have to interact with their opponents much. This allows them to get more gold than previously if they play well and intelligently, but punishes players for being overtly greedy.
Sometimes, I think Riot regrets releasing Soraka and Janna, and if they could remove them from the game, they could.
how do you think rift herald will be valued to champions who prefer to splitpush vs those who team fight
yes

I've found it to be pretty valuable regardless of your champion archetype. You can choose who picks up the trinket to summon Herald so it isn't too difficult to put it on someone who will go catch/push out a side wave at some point if you're worried about not getting to drop it in a vulnerable location when teams start grouping. Also keep in mind this despawns by 20 minutes so you generally won't be using this too far past the normal laning phase.

There are also a lot of different ways to play around it once you summon it. As a split-pusher you can use it in the side lane 1v1 and force multiple enemies to defend you or your lane opponent will likely have a difficult time killing it quickly solo with you there to defend it.

You can also look to use it as a straight up siege tool in team situations, as it will be quite difficult for the enemies to hit the eye without being punished when you have multiple people pushing with the herald. It will take a fair amount of ambient damage from waveclear spells etc. though.

If you manage to take Herald close to 20 minutes you can even setup sweet plays where you use the Herald as a split pusher to make your opponents respond to it while your team pressures Baron.

There's a lot of ways to use it and I'm interested to see what people come up with.

What happened to coin drops on champion take downs?

 I was really looking forward to the high risk high reward play-style of the new coin that was encouraged in the patch notes 
"_We want to make Ancient Coin’s rewards less consistently safe, allowing users more ways to show off skillful aggression while giving opponents more opportunity to punish mistakes._"

and Riot Limely telling me that 
"_As far gold generation, the Coin Line is tuned to have rough parity with the other two, excluding the coins generated by takedowns._"
got me all excited. 

Was it decided to just make the coin more risky and still give around the same rewards as the others?

Hi there PeepingPeafowl!

In regards to your coin drops on champion takedowns: 

They are still technically there and if you get a takedown, the coin automatically goes to you (Even applies to long range redemption takedowns and even in death!) -- If you're not really noticing it visually then no worries; we are currently working on a way to make this more visible.

Hope I addressed your question!

Please share funny / fustrating stories with the 3 major rework tanks. 

Please share funny / fustrating stories with rift herald.

please share funny / fustrating stories with itemizations.

Brian "Riot Madness Heroo" is our newest hire and he mains mid. On his very first day in his very first playtest, I was playing against him and had my jungler camp the shit out of him midlane, then we took Gerald the Rift Herald (She will always be Gerald to us in the playtest pit), and dropped her mid lane without giving him any context whatsoever as to what she did. If I remember correctly, his reaction was pretty amusing when she basically one shot his tower.
I thought her name was Duchess

Why did nomads medallion get its mana regen removed? 

I get that coin lost it in favour of mana 'coin' pick ups, but nomads builds out of faerie charm so it's a case where you actually lose stats building into it, and you don't even get further improved mana restoration from nomads mana drops compared to coin.

So, what're your plans for when Rift Herald obviates {{champion:75}}'s niche entirely?

Alsoalso, why the hell doesn't Dshield have anything that scales? And why is Doran's Ring still being allowed to be so goddamn stackable?

> And why is Doran's Ring still being allowed to be so goddamn stackable?

That's a good question. I hate that stacking rings is so good and think it makes top lane so much more boring personally.

I agree on stacking rings being boring but don't you think it's a systematic problem if every top lane tank needs a bunch of rings to be viable? I feel that with a better mana item (or just better mana costs) to allow tanks access waveclear they might not need to build so many rings to keep up with manaless champions (shen, renekton) or champions who can build a dorans blade and efficiently clear the wave with autoattacks (camille, fiora). I suspect the notion that mana is linked to ability power (which seems strange now that so many champions have AD ratios) may be to blame and something like mana or mana regen on dorans shield would fix it (though I don't know what the other unintended consequences would be).
Mages buy the shield to be both tanky and have mana?
Possibly. Giving up the damage from doran's ring would be a serious cost but maybe not enough to offset the strength of the defense+mana combination.

Here's an idea. Give Dshield a passive that generates mana when you get hit by stuff. Mages aren't likely to put themselves in a situation where they're getting hit just to get mana, whereas bruisers are trading all the time and a bit of mana compensation is nice.
Now that I like, mana if you can mitigate but not if you get pushed out of lane.

Gargoyle Stoneplate looks to me like a great item. However, it does seem like a couple niche cases will abuse them item. Darius springs to mind. He loves the defensive stats and the health, and his ultimate true damage is not reduced by the item active. Was this a problem in testing?

So, you're not going to list the 10+ stacked elephant in the room? {{champion:31}} 
jk. Darius is a problem too.
Just gonna throw this out here: I'm a huge Godzilla fan and watching Cho'Gath pop that active, grow to gigantic proportions and nom somebody makes me so happy.

ikr I take it you were happy about the Vandiril vid then :P
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E9MxM2NmH5g
I love it. I actually picked Cho'Gath in a playtest with the exact intention of doing a build like this and I wound up going like 1/13 and it crushed all hopes I had of finding success on the guy. :(

We played both Darius and Cho'gath with Stoneplate, as with any item there will be a few champions out of the cast of ~130 that benefit the most from it. I wouldn't be comfortable with pre-emptively nerfing them because we think they'd be good with it. Cho's interaction seems to have picked up some negative traction so we may look into it more though

Uh... about that new item Adaptive helm... I main teemo and kinda wonder if he was given thought when you guys tested that item because the "Taking magic damage from a spell or effect reduces all subsequent magic damage from that spell or effect by 15% for 4 seconds." passive, especially combined with the 55 extra MR and 300 HP, kinda shits all over him. all of his poison effects becomes 15% less effective, every auto after the initial will deal 15% reduced damage, the DoT on his shroom will be reduced 15% as well..... My fear is any tank starting this item will pretty much just shrug off his damage and destroy him.
It's supposed to counter champions with sustained magic damage as they've typically been crazy powerful. If it's too strong it'll be tuned/adjusted

Former eve main here, when i saw this item i just straight up abandoned her as a champion as she already needs to be 2 kills gold wise ahead of most other junglers to break even with them and now this item exists which destroys her already low damage Q and also cripples E as it also applies twice, all this combined with tanky hp cc protectors rising in popularity have made winning with eve an unfun chore that requires tripple the effort of other junglers to achieve the same results.

I guess what i am saying is you guys just going to leave eve in the gutter until her 6 month later rework? because i am pretty sure when this patches statistics come out eve's winrate shall take a dive straight down into the 20--40% range which should be concerning given the people who play her are only her mains due to her unique playstyle most players dont like.

We definitely thought of champions like Teemo. Hell, I main Cassio - I was terrified when this item showed up in the shop. It definitely looks scary on paper, but in practice I find that since tanks generally have less health than they have had in the past and the fact that champions like Cassio and Teemo have low down time on their spells, it's hard to really notice your damage getting reduced that much and doesn't feel all that bad.
Hi, have you ever tried to play cassio bot lane as the team carry ?
Oh HELL yeah. If I get autofilled bot in solo queue you better believe I'm locking in Cass bot. My team may not want me to play Cass bot but I want to play Cass bot. It's low key op hehe.

So cool, I have spammed her bot for about a month now and indeed it is really strong. 

I just have a problem with mana pre tear of the godess. Is it your case too and it is just what it is or do you have tips for me?

Cassio's lane is, in my opinion, weakest pre-Tear so I'm not surprised that you are finding yourself running into mana issues at that point in the game. I guess my advice would be to try to take the lane slow and focus on farming up for your Tear. When you do have enough for it, try to shove out and get it asap. If you find yourself stuck in lane for a while, I'd look to back with enough gold for Tear + Doran's Ring/Amp Tome.

Thanks, I'll try to push for a back once I have the gold for tear.

One more question.

Did you try gunblade on Cassiopeia?
I find it really cool since she has dps that lead to huge sustain and it has 80 ap and the additionnal burst + slow with the active is nice too.
I can imagine that it is replaced by rylai tho.

Have a nice day!

Saw your comment and decided to try it in a ranked game last night! Result:

http://imgur.com/6TfctxM


So to be honest, I got a super early lead this game, but with RoA and Gunblade I was healing for something like +100 HP per Twin Fang at some point in the game. :o

I think it's more troll than good though. Cassio wants so much stuff and I'm not sure it's worth giving up CDR/Rylais/Seraphs for Gunblade.
